headline: Rare Earth Stocks Rise On Trump $12 Billion Stockpile Report
summary: Rare earth stocks rallied on Monday morning on a report that the Trump administration is set to provide $10 billion in financing for a nearly $12 billion critical minerals stockpile.  Bloomberg reported the initiative known as Project Vault, which includes General Motors, Google and Boeing among more than a dozen early participants.  USA Rare Earth and MP Materials rose.

headline: Trump administration to create a strategic reserve for rare earths elements
summary: The Trump administration plans to deploy nearly $12 billion to create a strategic reserve of rare earth elements, a stockpile that could counter China's ability to use its dominance of these hard to process metals as leverage in trade talks.  The White House confirmed on Monday the start of “Project Vault,” which would initially be funded by a $10 billion loan from the US Export-Import Bank and nearly $1.67 billion in private capital.  During trade talks last year spurred by President Donald Trump's tariffs, the Chinese government restricted the exporting of rare earths that are needed for jet engines, radar systems, electric vehicles, laptops and phones.

raw.headline: Trump administration to create a strategic reserve for rare earths elements

During trade talks last year spurred by President Donald Trump's tariffs, the Chinese government restricted the exporting of rare earths that are needed for jet engines, radar systems, electric vehicles, laptops and phones.

headline: General Motors' Global Chief Media Officer, Shenan Reed, Joins IAB Tech Lab Board of Directors
summary: IAB Tech Lab, the global digital advertising technical standards-setting body, today announced that Shenan Reed, Global Chief Media Officer, General Motors (GM), has joined its Board of Directors, marking a historic first as the organization welcomes a brand marketer to its leadership team.

headline: Why Musk's Decision to End Model S/X Production Makes Sense for Tesla
summary: TSLA will end Model S and X to free factory space, cut low-return models, and accelerate its push into robots, autonomy, and AI-driven growth.

headline: 1 Reason to Buy These 2 Fierce Rivals
summary: Ford and General Motors are both known for their full-size trucks and SUVs, but investors should know them for the significant value the two automakers return.
